lines.text: Meeeeeeooooowwwwww. Kitty cat. I'm always where th'moneyzat.
[to a black couple who tipped him for washing their windshield]
Thank you. May all your children be white.
Who are you?
I'm a photographer
Yea, and I'm the Lone Ranger, but without a horse.
Maybe you ain't schizophrenic. Maybe you're just a saint.

[sees Matthew handing out smokes]
Meeeooow. Kitty cat, I'm always where th' money'zat
[pause]
Doncha know th' Bowery rate of exchange, boy?
No.
We here, in Washington Heights, that's in th' northern tip of the island of Manhattan, but we still operate at the Bowery rate.
Yeah, I don't know it.
Twenty cents, baby. Two thin dimes a smoke.
[holds smokes out to Matthew]

These my loosies. See, I th' loosies representative 'round here, y'understand? Now, y'settin' a bad example, boy. Y'takin' unfair advantage of dis here black man. I mean, how can a man compete yuh givin' it away fuh'nuthin'? See, it takes years to establish a rate of exchange an' yuh'destroyin' it in one night. Now you declare economic war on me
[gets up to grab Matthew]
, I declare it right back. You strike th' first blow, now it's my turn.
Thank you kindly.
It's your world, we just live on it...
A dime, Matthew! A dime!

This here little pill made by Mr. Johnson & Johnson. Th' God's true representative on earth. It ain't th' churches, or them synagogues, or the Pope... That jus' propaganda. It's th' pharmaceutical companies... Mr. Johnson & Johnson separatin' this black man from his pain. Yeh...
[takes pill]
Hallaluyah!

[thumping on door]
Let's go! Let's go! We got th' building comin' down! Everybody move it out!

[thumping on door]
We got th' building coming down! Everybody out! Let's go! Move it out!

[thumping on door]
Let's go, folks! Move it out!... Move it out! We've got five minutes!
Building's comin' down! We gotta move! C'mon now! Let's go, folks! Move it out!
Don't use that shit. Use this shit.
[hands Matthew his washer fluid]
